intro: Lastrea lanciloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lastrea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
